name: Chicken Gnocchi Soup
description: A hearty, filling soup built around chicken, cream, and gnocchi. Comfort food that actually keeps you full.
gist: Mirepoix, roux, stock, cream, chicken, herbs, gnocchi, spinach — in that order.
ingredients:
Chicken
Mirepoix (onion, celery, carrot) and garlic
2–3 tbsp butter
2–3 tbsp flour
Any herbs, dry or fresh
Chicken stock (about 1–1.5 L, depending on quantities)
Optional: milk and cream (for a creamier broth, ~2 parts stock, 1 part milk, 1 part cream)
Gnocchi
Heavy cream
Spinach
Optional: cooked and crumbled bacon
steps:
1. Chop chicken into bite-sized pieces.
2. Dice vegetables.
3. If using dark meat, sear the chicken first and remove from the pot. If using white meat, keep it aside for now.
4. Add oil and sauté vegetables over low heat.
5. Once fragrant and softened, add butter. Melt, then add flour and stir to form a roux.
6. Slowly add chicken stock, adding only part of it at first.
7. Use a stick blender to blend the soup until thick.
8. Add herbs.
9. Add the chicken to (or back into) the pot and simmer until cooked.
10. Add gnocchi and simmer until cooked, just a few minutes.
11. If using straight stock, add a splash of heavy cream and let the soup boil briefly to thicken.
12. Add a few handfuls of spinach.
13. Taste and adjust seasoning.
14. Serve and optionally top with crumbled bacon.
